intro: Cyphia lobelioides, commonly known as the slender mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and white, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows on the branches of eucalyptus and other host trees, deriving some of its nutrients from the host. Its fruits are small, red berries that contain seeds dispersed by birds. Cyphia lobelioides plays a role in the ecological interactions of its habitat, contributing to the biodiversity of forest ecosystems.
